course.subject: ISOM
course.name: Social Media: Collective Intelligence & Creativity
course.description: This course provides an analysis of the power of social media, such as Facebook, twitter, blogs, mashups, wikis, etc.  It examines how social media can facilitate creativity and collective intelligence, through enhanced information sharing and online collaboration among netizens; ultimately building the social pool of knowledge.  It also examines the downside of this participatory culture.

reviews.author: Endrave
reviews.title: Abstract
reviews.comment_content: In general it is like a business school version ICT, it include the history of the internet and web page, searching engine, crowd sourcing, etc. Simple and wide ranged , good way to broaden your horizon
reviews.comment_teaching: before mid term , he tried to be fun and make the class interesting. however, after midterm you will realized the content is more abstract , as they use a lot of metaphor as key term , e.g. ant death spiral to represent the act of blindly following other without critically thinking. In the exam you are require to explain these terms again in essay format . If you don't understand them in class, you don't stand a chance in exam.
reviews.comment_grading:
I can't say much on grading, but i do have opinion on marking.
this is a common core, which is non-business student will also take it. the presentation at the end of the course have a large impact to your final grade, especially you fail it hard.

when i say fail, is not like your group suck or you don't have the ability to do so. I am talking about the presentation method, i will say my group use very simple powerpoint and explain most of the thing with speech clearly in an engineering way, however, the professor like those powerpoint which is full of texts, none of us see that coming and we ends up with 5.6/ 10 a.k.a lower quarter.

i got above mean in midterm and final and way below mean in the project still got B+ ,
reviews.comment_workload:
Every week there will be a assignment or lab

Ranging from reading an article and answer question to post a tweet in twitter , use google to search where the quote ,image, soundtrack origin from, use online website to Photoshop a  meme and post it, spent some money on a kick starter , etc

there is a group project at the end of the course, about how to make use of 'web 2.0' and other concept mentioned in the course to make business model successful.

in general workload aren't that big, however, effort and grade is not proportional.

reviews.author: llllllll123
reviews.title: A good grade course
reviews.comment_content:
Some key features of Web2.0 and how those features can be applied in a real case, like Wiki or Netflix. I think some of the contents is not updated but it is still interesting to know more about the development of web2.0. The contents is not hard  and easy to follow. Even you do not fully pay attention on lessons, you can still google search online to get a brief idea.
Key concepts include: Network effect, Collective Intelligence, Crowdsourcing, Folksonomy & Social Media, Social Network, Blogs , Wikipedia, Open Source Software & Creative Commons
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching is quite boring but the prof sometimes play video and perform real case demonstration in class. There is around half hour break every lesson. Sometimes, he mutes himself without consciousness and he has to repeat the points lol, please be patient during the class
He is a nice teacher and willing to answer the questions, so don't be shy. You can email him directly instead of TA because the prof usually responds faster and more accurate. Pay attention to Q&A session, the prof will give some tips or instructions on the assignment
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments (1-4)   8%
Assignment 5 (group)           5%
Reading Assignments (5) 15%
After Class Exercises (8/9) 16%
Class Participation 18%
Project Presentation 10%
Project Reports (2)   8%
Final Exam 20%
Most of the people get full mark in assignment 1-5
There are 5 Reading Assignments which you may spend time to read and answer 3 questions per each.
After class-exercises are submitted after every lesson, most of the people also get full mark in this part
Class participation is counted by attendance and responsiveness during the class, it is encouraged that you should type something in chatbot every lecture
Project part is quite important and time consuming, you have to form group by yourself, hopefully there is no freerider in your group
Final Exam is open book which consists of 3 essay questions, study guides are provided by the prof and you just need to follow it. 4 reading materials are required for exams, take a brief look before the exam
My grade
Assignments(1-5):full , Reading assignments: approximately 90%, After class ex: full, Class participation: full, Project report slightly below mean (mean 94.3), Presentation slightly above mean (mean 7/10), Final exam: Not known
Final Grade: A
reviews.comment_workload: There are many assignments, reading assignments and after-class exercises, but it does not take much time to complete. Thea heaviest workload is from the project which we have to prepare the report and presentation within a week (of course you can have a better time management). I did not spend much time on exam, just follow the study guides for revision. Generally, the workload is acceptable

reviews.author: Seeking4u()
reviews.title: You deserve a better SA common core
reviews.comment_content: Some outdated Web 2.0 concepts. Take other courses to fulfill the SA/Elective requirement for common core if you wanna learn something interesting or useful.
reviews.comment_grading:
How we are graded in the end remains non-transparent and arbitrary as scores for the final exam and the presentation deck are not released. I received either full mark or above mean for other sections, and ended up in B-.

After-class Exercises: 20%
- Answer 2-3 questions based on the lecture, released after each lesson

5 Reading Assignments: 15%
- Answer 3-4 questions based on 1-2 articles assigned

5 Assignments: 10%
- Some random tasks (seriously?) such as (1) sharing 1 video and 1 image in canvas discussions (2) using twitter to share a meme that you created... (3) using google search to locate information... (4) using diigo (5) researching on 2 crowdsourcing projects

Class Participation: 15%
- Based on the attendance recorded by Zoom, and how active we responded to the professor's questions (by typing in the Zoom chatroom)

Project Presentations: 10%
- One compulsory chat session with the professor on the project proposal, and one presentation (presentation deck needs to be submitted too)

Project Reports: 10%
- One project proposal and one project report

Final Exam: 20%
- Three-hour take-home exam
reviews.comment_workload: Given that the entire course is crammed within three weeks, the workload can be quite intense. The workload mostly comes from coordinating the team to produce a project proposal, talk about this proposal with the professor, produce a project report and a project presentation deck, and finally present it to the professor. All of these become rather painful when your teammates are free-riding.

reviews.author: AL_
reviews.comment_content:
The content is mainly about social network and web 2.0. Don't expect it to be very technical. Most of the content are business stuff.
I am not sure of the content is slightly adjusted for the winter semester.

Course Description from Canvas

The ubiquitous presence of social media has reshaped the web from a medium of deliver information to a platform for participation.  Web technology is now connecting a diversity of people and idea and encouraging cooperation and collaboration.  This course will examine the impact of the open and peer-to-peer collaborations that are the underpinning Web 2.0. In addition to learning Web 2.0 enabling technologies, students will also understand the social and philosophical implications of this phenomenon.


This class is open to undergraduates in all disciplines with either technical or non-technical backgrounds. Course work will include lectures,  class discussion, homework, lab, and project presentation.
Week

Topic

Notes

02/Jan/2019

Web 2.0 - Overview



04/Jan/2019

Network effect, Long Tail & Web 2.0



07/Jan/2019

Search – Database of Intention



09/Jan/2019

Collective Intelligence

  

11/Jan/2019

Crowdsourcing

Project Proposal Due



14/Jan/2019

Mid-term  

Folksonomy & Social Media



16/Jan/2019

Social Network, Blogs & Wikipedia



18/Jan/2019

Open Source Software

21/Jan/2019

Creative Commons & Mashup

23/Jan/2019

Project Presentation



25/Jan/2019

Final Exam
reviews.comment_teaching: He is nice and funny. But mainly focusing on the ppt and the examples in the notes. Don't expect too much. He will print all notes for you
reviews.comment_grading:
Course Requirements:

Assignments (1-5)                                            10%

Assignment #6 (Group)                                       4%

Reading Assignments (3)                                    6%

Project Presentation                                          10%

Project Reports  (2)                                           10%

Mid Term                                                         20%

Final Exam                                                       40%

The assignment is super easy, you can get full mark easily as long as you put a little bit effort.
The project is short and simple, you can do any topic you want. Just hand in the proposal and give a casual presentation.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is ok. No attendance will be taken, no need to go to class. Assignment and exams are all straight forward and simple.

reviews.author: ptrknow
reviews.comment_content:
睇你個人鐘唔鐘意social media果堆野
好似我咁 如果一丁點興趣都無 就會覺得教嘅野
好悶 好無聊 無組織 無重點 解釋唔系解釋
當然啦 如果你都叫有些少興趣系度
咁你嘅睇法或許同我會好唔同

See if you are interested in the stuff of social media or not.
If you are like me, having no interest in this stuff at all, then you will definitely find the content very boring, unorganized and pointless.
That being said, your view could become quite different when you have that kind of interest, even if it's just a little bit.
reviews.comment_teaching:
+ 間唔中搞gag
+ ok幽默
+ 每堂俾15-20min break
+ 每堂有handout派

- 奇怪嘅口音 + 十分快嘅語速 = 大部分時間聽唔明
- 大部分時間好無聊 → 發呆 / 玩手機 / 訓zzzz


+ make jokes occasionally
+ quite humorous
+ 15-20min break each lesson
+ provide handout each lesson

- strange accent plus fast pace of speaking → undecipherable
- boring most of the time, making you fall asleep or distracted
reviews.comment_grading:
其實真系幾好grade
不過你要背野 / 肯背野
跟住個study guide系幾日入面背哂d ppt slides佢
midterm final都要睇reading

midterm應該系主要決定grade嘅部分(final唔出分 所以唔知)
目測踩mean都有B 所以俾d心機背啦
你唔鐘意背嘢嘅話就唔好格硬黎啦


good grade if you can memorize things
no pain no gain
follow the study guide to memorize all the required ppt slides and go through all the readings

midterm is decisive to your grade (don't really know about the final because final mark will not be released)
Mean should get you a B
If you really hate rote memorisation, you are strongly discouraged from taking this course
reviews.comment_workload:
如果d嘢系分散系3幾個月度
咁呢個course至多就2個credit

不過集中系一個月就唔同講法
assignment都幾多 黎得都幾密
不過就唔難做嘅 要用嘅時間都唔算話真係好多

最麻煩最大workload都係group project
其次就系背野

There are quite a number of assignments, so the schedule is quite tightly packed as you have only one short month. Though, if these things are distributed over 3 months, then I think this course won't worth 3 credits.

Group project is of the highest workload. Memorisation comes the next.

reviews.author: kosintungko
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite easy to handle that it is all about social media and some details about Web2.0. It is quite interesting.
reviews.comment_teaching: I seldom have lesson, but the professor is quite funny. He makes use of the video and powerpoint to make the lesson funny. However, as I have this lesson in summer semster, the teaching speed is quite fast that one week one examination.
reviews.comment_grading: Good Grade. I was above around 1SD in mid term and complete all assessment, and I scored A in this course. For the examination, there will be guideline, simply follow the guidlines can perform well in the examination
reviews.comment_workload: Not heavy. Only a few easy assessment ( open an twitter account/ do some search on Web2.0)and the only heavy workload is group project.

reviews.author: javanlam
reviews.comment_content:
Mainly about Web 2.0, COMP and CPEG students should know enough about the technical details for this course.

Contents in each lesson:
- History of the Internet, Web 2.0
- Mashups, Network Effect, Long Tail, Search Engines
- Collective Intelligence, Wisdom of Crowd
- Folksonomy, Crowdsourcing
- Blogs, Social Media
- Social Networks, Wiki
- Creative Commons, Open Source
- The downside of Web 2.0

The content is not very difficult, if you go to classes or watch recordings (which started to be provided after request in this term) you should understand it.

Both exams involve MC questions (around 50), matching (taken from tables in the slides) and essays (requires explaining concepts in slides; may be based on given readings).
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lessons are lively, the prof makes a lot of jokes. He shows videos as examples of certain concepts.
Live demonstrations also happen (he will go to the HKUST page on wikipedia and change something when he talks about the self-regulation of wiki content).
reviews.comment_grading:
Requirements for the course:
- 4 individual assignments, 2.5% each
- 1 group assignment, 5%
- 5 reading assignments (simple comprehension questions based on a given news article), 4% each
- Midterm exam, 20%
- Project presentation, 10%
- Project report, 10%
- Final exam, 25%

Midterm Statistics:
Mean: 61.54 (full mark: 100)
SD: 13.76
Max: 82
Min: 28

I got almost full in both assignments and reading assignments. My group project was pretty high as well (presentation 8/10, report nearly full). My midterm was around 1 SD above mean, final unknown.
Final letter grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is pretty light, only that deadlines come pretty frequently during the summer semester.
Answering questions in less than 200 words can score you full marks in reading assignments; assignments are simple work and you can score full also by simply following the instructions.
The project is the main lump of workload in the course, but my group finished it in one night almost without even communicating.

Review the slides around two times, make sure you remember the examples and understand the concepts, then you will be fine for the exams.

reviews.author: dying
reviews.title: Do not register this in winter!!!!!!!
reviews.comment_content:
Overall, I think the content is interesting. However, the course was so tightly packed and intensive. The lectures were at 9 am for 3 hours twice a week. I often fell asleep and did not pay attention to class even tho the content was ok to look at.  

03/Jan/2022 Web 2.0 - Overview  
05/Jan/2022 Network effect, Long Tail, Mashup, Search –
Database of Intention
07/Jan/2022 Collective Intelligence  
10/Jan/2022 Crowdsourcing & Kiva   
12/Jan/2022 Project Proposal Due  
14/Jan/2022 Folksonomy & Social Media  
17/Jan/2022 Lab Demo ; Social Network, Blogs , Wikipedia  
19/Jan/2022 Open Source Software & Creative Commons
21/Jan/2022 Dark Sides of Web - Fake News, Trolls, Data
Surveillance
24/Jan/2022 Final Exam
reviews.comment_teaching: I don't like Jack's voice and accent. I could not understand properly without paying an effort to listen to his lectures. His spoke fast and I most of the time fell asleep during his classes and missed some iPRS. His powerpoint slides were kinda plain and not helpful for his assignments and exams.
reviews.comment_grading:
Course Requirements:
Assignments (1-4)   8%
Assignment 5 (group)   5%
Reading Assignments (5) 15%
After Class Exercises (8/9) 16%
Class Participation 18%
Project Presentation 10%
Project Reports (2)   8%
Final Exam 20%

The course was very VERY intensive, I did not want to pay any effort into this course as it was very cold that winter and the workload were heavy. In the end, I got a B from him. I regret registering for this course as I would rather be doing an internship or part time job.
reviews.comment_workload: Huge workload, as this is a 3-credit course packed in less than a month. I genuinely did not know what was happening throughout the winter semester. There were 9 after class exercises which are kinda annoying. For real doing a real job is much better than enrolling to this course. I will not suggest anyone to reg this course.

reviews.author: Annikak
reviews.comment_content: It's a good course to take to boost your cga. It uncovers some topics about Web 3.0 that are generally interesting and the professor is nice and interactive. Do keep in mind that class participation is 18% of the grade, so it greatly matters that you speak up and interact in this class.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teacher is good and open to students' comments.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is okay, I didn't do too well with the group project but covered up with the final and assignments.
reviews.comment_workload: There is a decent amount of workload, considering that an assignment is due 6 hours after your class ends , with the short assignment covering what was taught in class.

reviews.author: myle
reviews.title: Pretty decent Winter course
reviews.comment_content: I find the content pretty fun, it covers collective intelligence and the web 2.0 concepts, but the stuff are pretty basic, so it's very easy to pick up.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is pretty average, but since the content is relatively easy, you can understand most of the course just by going over the readings and the slides,
reviews.comment_grading: Based on the marks I've gotten for my assignments and readings, the grading is quite fair, and the professor does give you a criteria on how you can achieve a high score.
reviews.comment_workload: Work load is quite reasonable for a winter course, there is only an assignment after every lesson, a few readings in between, one final project, and one exam. I'll say its on par with most 3 credits courses.

reviews.author: Kachun0921
reviews.title: Good and Funny course
reviews.comment_content:
Not too much content as expected, maybe because it is in winter sem.
Mainly about Web 2.0 and related concepts such as collective intelligence, crowdsourcing, outsourcing, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is very humorous and always ask students question. He also uses a lot of videos in lecture but it may be a bit boring since the lecture last for three hours.
But final is a bit rush because the lecturer uses only two lecture to finish the whole syllabus of the final exam.
reviews.comment_grading:
Great grading!
I got one SD below midterm and slightly above mean in final and I got  B+!
Also, the grading for group project is nice too and everybody gets around full mark!
reviews.comment_workload:
Only 6 assignment but very easy, funny and short, one of them are just using Twitter. I think using 15 mins can finish each assignment.
Bear in mind that there is a group project as well but workload is not as heavy as expected.
Bear in mind that some reading material is required but just some of the content of the reading as the professor will highlight the key part.

reviews.author: mini1999
reviews.title: so far so good
reviews.comment_content:
mainly about Web 2.0
topics include: web 2.0, network effect & long tail, search engine, collective intelligence & wisdom of crowd, crowdsourcing, folksonomy, mashup, kiva, social media, blog, wiki, social network, open source, creative commons
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof speaks quite fast so you need to pay more attention otherwise you will get lost. He likes asking questions and sometimes he comes in front of you and asks you, but it's okay if you don't know how to answer because basically no one knows how to answer.
Since all the materials have to be taught within one month, so many things are covered in one lesson.
He doesn't count attendance but I think it's better to attend all the lectures as he explains a lot of terms in the lessons, which you may not understand if you just read the notes.
He gives 15-20-minute break every lesson, so you won't feel to tired to attend a 3-hour lesson, but actually he ends lesson earlier.
reviews.comment_grading:
mt: below mean a little bit
assignments: all full marks except one is just on mean
project + presentation: both below mean a little bit
final: doesn't release the mark
Grade: B-
For me, I think the grade is quite good already since actually i didn't get high mark in both mt and the project, even for the final, I felt like I didn't know how to do, but turns out the grade isn't that bad.
Mt is easy as many questions are just come from the notes word by word, just for the short questions you really have to read the reading materials.
Final is much more difficult.
What I suggest is try to get above mean in mt and even if you are not doing well in final, mt helps you get a better grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
5 individual assignments
1 group assignment
1 group project with presentation
1 mt
1 final
Workload is quite heavy as you just have one month. Less than 2 weeks after the mt, then it is final. And for the project, you just have around 2.5 weeks to do.
Also, you have to read a lot of reading materials for both exams, but he will tell you what to read just a few days before the exams. Therefore, do revision for the notes in advance so that you can get enough time to read the readings within that few days.

reviews.author: t
reviews.title: ISOM 1090
reviews.comment_content:
Illustrate the concepts of web 2.0 and social media
with a lot of examples such as Kiva, Twitter.
You could relate your daily life experience to this course easily
reviews.comment_teaching: A bit boring, but you have to pay attention in class
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm above around 1 SD
Get full mark for all assignment
but project presentation is just around mean
I still got A

Follow study guideline when you do revision. Then, you will get high mark easily
reviews.comment_workload:
Acceptable workload:
-few assignments and 3 reading assigment
-project proposal, proposal oral presentation, report, and project presentation

reviews.author: holam
reviews.title: ISOM 1090
reviews.comment_content:
Boring
Test you the skill of rote memorizing
It is about concept of Web 2.0.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Boring
Need to attend lecture although attendance is not taken. Some of the keywords are discussed in class.
A lot of example do not mean that it is interesting and can make the concept clear. But try to drop down the example as they will test in exam.
Professor itself do not answer student question well. I cannot get the marking from his answer.
Need not attend useless tutorial.
reviews.comment_grading:
HW X5+ group HW X1 +reading assignment X3 (20%)
Project (20%)
Mid term (20%) me 63/100 mean 68/100
Final (40%) not released
Letter grade: B+ , not good


Year 1 student please DO NOT take this class as you will see a lot of senior year student. You need a lot more effort.
reviews.comment_workload:
A bit huge, but still less than a normal semester
HW just fill in with some words and fulfill requirement. Everyone got full mark.
Project is not worth mark-efficiency.
Only try to have a good presentation(like LABU)
Please do focus on mid-term and final.
A lot of reading materials will be tested in BOTH MC and long question.
Also remember to follow the study guide which is very useful.
MC is tricky and require rote memorization of every lecture slide.

reviews.author: Amberrr
reviews.comment_content:
Topic
Web 2.0 - Overview
Network effect, Long Tail & Web 2.0
Search – Database of Intention
Collective Intelligence
Crowdsourcing
Folksonomy & Social Media
Social Network, Blogs & Wikipedia
Open Source Software
Creative Commons & Mashup
reviews.comment_teaching: The professional is quite funny. There is a 20 miuntes break in each lecure. He used lots of examples to elaborate the related concepts which helps us deeply understand them. There are many interactions in the class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Course Requirements:

Assignments (1-5)                                            10%

Assignment #6 (Group)                                       4%

Reading Assignments (3)                                    6%

Project Presentation                                          10%

Project Reports  (2)                                           10%

Mid Term                                                         20%

Final Exam                                                       40%
reviews.comment_workload: A lot of assignments but the assignments are very easy. There are 1 group project and 1 group assignment. You can choose the topic group project freely.

reviews.author: Ust fishman
reviews.title: Good Prof
reviews.comment_content: About the features of Web2.0. The contents are not difficult. Before the mid term exam, the focus will be Web2.0, it will change to open source after the exam. The content is very relevant to daily life.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very interesting. Good. He uses many everyday life examples to illustrate the concepts, so it’s easy to understand the materials.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair grading. It depends on your attention in the lessons. The grading of the project is also quite good and you can get full mark in the assignment easily.
reviews.comment_workload:
5 individual assignments
1 group assignment
1 group project
3 reading assignments

reviews.author: Minmay
reviews.title: A fair course to study in the long January vacation
reviews.comment_content: The content is rather simple. It focused on Web 2.0 in the first bit, and open source after the mid term, which is a little more difficult. It also taught the relationship of social media to web 2.0, and gave a lot of examples like crowdsourcing, crowdfunding, wikipedia, mashups and so on. It was quite interesting and manageable, but you would need to remember all the slides to handle the exams. There were a lot of key terms and concepts you might need to memorise, and those required in the exams would be provided to you beforehand with a study guide prepared by the professor. There was also quite an amount of reading materials, some of which were required in the exams.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor has a weird accent, it is hard to understand. He is not a really helpful or caring guy. But he can deliver the lectures in quite a humorous way, so you may not feel too bored. He would give demonstrations and explanation to the reading materials. Lecture notes were also printed for you, which was great.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading was not bad. I admittedly did not study enough before going for both the mid term and the exams. My mid term marks was approximately 10 marks below mean, but I got a B-. I didn't compare to others, but I guess only really rare cases would receive a C range grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload was heavy, as of all winter courses. 6 assignments, project proposal and report, presentation, mid-term, final exam, they were all to be done in one month or less. Good and responsible group mates are important, don't miss the first class, you might need to assemble your group as quick as possible. Assignments were rather simple, only 2 or 3 required writing up essays or reports, but just finishing them would guarantee full marks. MT and final exams had 40-50 MCs, 3 matching questions, and essay questions. MT had 2-3, finals had 8, both short and long.

reviews.author: karentong
reviews.comment_content: The content is not difficult at all. Contrarily, I think it is quite interesting and easy. The content is all about Web 2.0 and people's interaction in Web 2.0 era.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teh is a funny teacher and he will try to use an interesting way to teach, though his accent is quite strange. Besides, his teaching materials, especially the articles are adequate supplement to his teaching content.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair.
reviews.comment_workload: It has a midterm exam, final exam and a project (requires presentation). There are four assignments but they are extremely easy and if you follow the guide very carefully, you can easily get full marks.

reviews.author: bsiu
reviews.comment_content: It is a summer course. Therefore, the course is quite intensive. The content is not difficult at all and it is quite easy.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teh is quite a good teacher and always try to use a funny way to teach the students. However, his accent is quite strange.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is great. My project did not do well (just mean). But I get a good result in midterm (above mean almost 1 sd). My finally grading is A
reviews.comment_workload: It includes a midterm exam, final exam and a project. The professor will provide a study guide and the questions on the exam is based on those guides. For the project, if you have good teammates, it should be no problems.

reviews.author: Diane
reviews.comment_content: The course teaches about Web2.0, where web users are contributors of the web. You can definitely learn some new stuff in this course without the content being too technical.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor is pretty fun, he often jokes during lectures. His accent may be hard to understand for some. Need some time to get used to it.

Videos and some extra readings are used in lectures to make it less boring.
reviews.comment_grading: The project takes up quite a large portion of the grades beside the finals. You must not screw them up
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is rather heavy than other courses as it has a group project and presentation. But if you have group mates to share the work with, everything is okay.

You only need to read a small amount of extra readings and lecture notes for midterms and finals. For the project, workload is adequate, just like every other project, you need to do research, conduct a progress report and the final report.

reviews.author: YT
reviews.comment_content: This course is mainly about web 2.0 and social media. The content is easy to understand but there is quite a lot of theories to memorise.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is funny, make jokes during the boring lecture. but tbh his accent is a bit hard to understand.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments 15%
Project Presentation 10%
Two Project Progress Reports 5%
Mid Term 25%
Final Exam 45%

easy assessments (e.g. create an account in twitter), midterm&final are based on the study guide he distributes before exam.
Part I: 40-50 MC questions
Part II: 2-3 matching questions  
Part III: 4-5 short essay questions
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload. no attendance is taken. There is only a short presentation needed.

reviews.author: Yanice
reviews.comment_content: The concepts are actually not difficult but Professor does not go deep into the explanations during lectures. Hence, I have to prepare quite a lot for the mid term or final. Both mid term and final consist of MC, short essay and some matchings.
reviews.comment_teaching: Jack is an interesting instructor. He made jokes and his accent is super funny. Therefore you never find his lesson boring. Also he uses different media to illustrate concepts in order to let us to have a better understanding.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is quite good. My midterm result is above mean around 1 sd but I am not sure about my final result. All the project-related stuff like presentation and progress reports are below mean. And finally I got A in the course.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is low. There are around 4 assignments and they are extremely easy which you can finish each of them within 5 minutes and get full mark. As for the project, we are required to hand in 2 progress reports and deliver a final presentation only. The project topic is chosen by ourselves.

reviews.author: jamesab
reviews.title: Good grade course
reviews.comment_content:
Web 2.0 features and some related content like:
Folksonomy
Search engine
Blog
Wiki
Collective intelligence
network effect
long tail effect
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor is funny, he always ask question to students (very casual) and his interaction to the answers are quite funny (maybe because those answers are out of his expectation)
His have wired accent but I can still follow it after the first lesson
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grading.
Assignments (1-5)                                            10%

Assignment #6 (Group)                                       4%

Reading Assignments (3)                                    6%

Project Presentation                                          10%

Project Reports  (2)                                           10%

Mid Term                                                         20%

Final Exam                                                       40%

For group project and present, professor will give quite high mark. I got 1SD above in both mid-term and final exam, finally got A-
reviews.comment_workload:
Low workload for me. Although there are 6 assignments, all are very easy and you only need to spend about 15min for each assignments.
For reading assignments, I just use google translate to read the passages and get nearly full mark
For the mid-term and final, professor will provide a study guide, simply following the study guide can get a high mark.
Remember to read those readings in the study guide as they will be tested in the exam in the essay part

reviews.author: lmng
reviews.comment_content: The course is about social media so the content is very relevant to daily life.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor tried to make the lectures as interesting as possible. He uses many everyday life examples to illustrate the concepts, so it’s easy to understand the materials.
reviews.comment_grading: It’s easy to get high score in the exams. The grade is pretty good.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is very small. Only 3-4 assignments which can be finished within an hour. There’s also a project and a presentation. The topic again is related to social media and Web 2.0.

reviews.author: JM48
reviews.title: Social media: collective intelligence and creativity
reviews.comment_content: As an active user of social media, I am interested in the course. The contents are so interesting as you can relate them to your daily life. You know more about stuff related to collective intelligence as well.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof jack is a very funny professor and he is very passionate about the lessons. He used a lot of interesting examples and videos in the class. It is easy to ask him questions too. His gesture snd way of talking would definitely impress you.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid term exam: mean
Final exam: Unknown
All assignment done
Project report: below mean one sd
Project preparation: below mean one sd
Grade I got: B
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is affordable. There are five assignments in total,with each rate 2%. The assignment is very easy and usually get full marks from these. The midterm and final exams include MC,fill in the blank,matching and essay questions. As long as you remember all the contents in PowerPoint, It is easy to get high mark in exams. However,the competition is severe as well.

reviews.author: Mohit
reviews.title: Good course
reviews.comment_content: Content is easy yet interesting. Exams are well made and professor releases a study guide before the exam. He actually sticks to his study guide during the exam, i.e. the questions actually resonate with what Professor TEH tells you to revise.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof TEH makes the classes interesting. He brings in interesting case studies and real-world examples.
No attendance requirement (apart from appearing in your own final presentation...), and a lot of freedom on the final group project, for which he gives you lots of time.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grading.
reviews.comment_workload: 5 easy assignments (take less than 20 mins each); 1 group essay; 1 group presentation

reviews.author: Kaiser
reviews.comment_content:
Web 2.0
Theme:
Long Tail
Network Effect
Leveling Effect
etc
not quite interesting but can learn a lot from it.
reviews.comment_teaching:
strange accent
But it is acceptable.
Although Professor wants to make the class fun, it is quite boring.
There are 15 to 20 mins break. Sometimes may have 30 mins break but only once
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments (1-4)  8%
Assignment 5 (group)  5%
Reading Assignments (5)15%
After Class Exercises (8/9)16%
Class Participation 18%
Project Presentation10%
Project Reports (2)  8%
Final Exam20%
All Assignments are easy to get marks.
The final exam just follows the study guideline.
Some assignments are interesting.
reviews.comment_workload: Not large. All of the Assignments can be easily done. Each reading assignment contains only a few pages. There are 3 questions on each reading and after class exercise. After the class exercise, you can find the answer to the notes. The workload for the project is not high for me since one of the groupmate did almost all the project so we can just focus on the present. Overall, the workload is low.

reviews.author: totoro
reviews.comment_content:
The course is a very short one teaching about Web 1.0 and Web 2.0, how people communicate with the two, etc.
The project alongside presentation is the main dish of the course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Although the professor speaks English in an Asian way, he is not Chinese.  He is kind and funny but hard to understand.  We get frustrated a lot of times communicating with him and he is unable to have long span of focus on the same subject.  Also, he is a kind of forgetful.  In a nutshell, he is a grandpa.
reviews.comment_grading:
The professor is kind and grade generously most of the time.  There were times that he really pay attention to your work and grade more strictly but generally the grading is safe.
When you discuss the project topic with the professor, you may find it difficult to communicate with him because you know nothing about the subject and he knows so much already.  Note that he wants new ideas for the topics and the reports, a.k.a. he wants us to generate new ideas for him.  So better be prepared with more topics with fresh ideas for him or else the grade for the meeting with him will suffer.  All in all, the final project grading is fine.
reviews.comment_workload:
It really comes down to the quality of your group-mates.
After every lessons, students have to answer some questions on that day and the professor will mark it.
There are missions to be done with social web platforms, some article-reading-plus-question-answering and tiny workload of research periodically but those were extremely easy tasks.
The written report only requires something like 5 pages with font-size 12.
